text: yed speech and language development - Intrauterine growth retardation - Microdontia - Partial agenesis of the corpus callosum - Postnatal growth retardation - Widely spaced teeth - The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) has collected information on how often a sign or symptom occurs in a condition. Much of this information comes from Orphanet, a European rare disease database. The frequency of a sign or symptom is usually listed as a rough estimate of the percentage of patients who have that feature
